discoveredAssets: localhost:32768 - Loan Management Web Application (Apache 2.4.65) - Port 32768, authenticated
localhost:32768/login - Authentication endpoint - Form-based login with test credentials visible in HTML comment
localhost:32768/home - Dashboard endpoint - Protected authenticated home page showing user welcome
localhost:32768/profile - User profile management - Editable loan and personal information (POST enabled)
localhost:32768/loan_details - Loan details display - AJAX-powered loan calculation functionality
localhost:32768/total_loan_payments - Loan calculation API - GET-only JSON endpoint for calculating total payments
localhost:32768/logout - Session termination - Clears session cookie and redirects to login
localhost:32768/static/ - Static assets - Bootstrap CSS/JS and jQuery libraries accessible

targets.objective: Test authentication mechanism for vulnerabilities including SQL injection, NoSQL injection, authentication bypass, default credentials validation, session management flaws, and brute force resistance
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint with hardcoded test credentials (test:test) visible in HTML source. Login form accepts POST requests - needs comprehensive authentication security testing.

targets.objective: Test for business logic vulnerabilities including unauthorized data modification, parameter tampering, and manipulation of loan-related fields (loan_amount, loan_term_months, monthly_payment). Test authorization controls and field value validation.
targets.rationale: High-risk endpoint that allows modification of sensitive loan parameters through POST requests. Potential for users to manipulate loan amounts or terms, and for horizontal privilege escalation via direct parameter manipulation.

targets.objective: Test API endpoint for injection vulnerabilities (SQLi, NoSQLi), input validation bypasses, parameter manipulation, and information disclosure. Test various parameter combinations including negative values, zero values, and boundary conditions.
targets.rationale: API endpoint with input validation that rejects decimal points. Test whether validation can be bypassed, if calculation logic has flaws, and if endpoint leaks sensitive information through error messages.

targets.objective: Comprehensive security assessment including: CSRF protection on all forms, XSS vulnerabilities in user input fields and output, session management security (cookie flags, timeout, fixation), and overall application security architecture.
targets.rationale: Main application requires comprehensive security assessment covering common web vulnerabilities, business logic flaws, and session security to identify all potential attack vectors.

targets.objective: Test for horizontal privilege escalation, IDOR vulnerabilities, and unauthorized access to other users' data. Verify authentication and authorization controls on dashboard content.
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint that displays user-specific information. Should be tested to ensure users cannot access other users' data through session manipulation or direct parameter changes.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Test credentials hardcoded in HTML comment (test:test) - exposes testing account for unauthorized access
[CRITICAL] /login endpoint lacks visible CSRF protection token in form - potential CSRF vulnerability
[HIGH] /profile endpoint accepts POST requests allowing modification of sensitive loan parameters without apparent authorization controls
[HIGH] Application uses simple Cookie-based session management - potential for session fixation or prediction attacks if cookies are predictable
[MEDIUM] /total_loan_payments API endpoint has input validation (rejects decimals) - but validation logic may be bypassable with special characters or encoding
[MEDIUM] HTML pages use Bootstrap framework without apparent CSP or security headers - potential for XSS attacks
[MEDIUM] Static assets directory structure is guessable - potential information disclosure through static file analysis
[LOW] Application enforces authentication on protected endpoints (redirects to /login) - basic access control is implemented
